title: COVID 19 appointment and visitation guidelines
description: Information for patients at CHoR during COVID-19. Appointment and visitation guidelines for you and your family to reference as we responsibly restore clinics, surgical services and therapies that were temporarily closed or postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.
cleaned_text: 2023: Masking is optional throughout all Children's Hospital of Richmond at VCU facilities, with a few exceptions for direct inpatient care and high-risk patient care areas. [Learn more before your next visit. ](https://www.chrichmond.org/blog/masks-no-longer-required-in-all-chor-hospitals-and-clinics-what-to-know-before-your-next-visit) Visitation guidelines Children's Tower pediatric intensive care (level 9) and acute care pediatrics (levels 10 and 12) - 2 adult visitors at the bedside at a time from 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. - 4 adults permitted on patient's approved visitor list throughout their stay - 2 parents/caregivers are given badges that grant access the to child's unit and amenities (family gym, playrooms, indoor garden, etc.) - 2 additional adult visitors are given badges that only access the child's unit - 2 parents can spend the night in the room - Siblings permitted from 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. (Siblings to not count as one of the 2 visitors at the bedside, i.e. a patient can have 2 parents and siblings at the bedside at once.) - NOTE: See special guidelines below for cellular immunotherapies and transplant unit patients who are hospitalized on level 12 Children's Tower acute care pediatrics cellular immunotherapies and transplant unit (level 12) - 2 adult visitors at a time from 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. - 2 parents can spend the night in the room - Masks are required at all times unless eating or sleeping Children's ER Transitional Care Unit - We have unrestricted inside visitation and visitors are encouraged to contact the TCU social worker to schedule use of a visitation room. Virginia Treatment Center for Children - 2 adult visitors at a time from 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. - 4 adults permitted on patient's approved visitor list throughout their stay - 1 parent can spend the night in the room Neonatal Intensive Care Unit - 2 adult visitors at a time from 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. - 4 adults permitted on patient's approved visitor list throughout their stay - 1 parent can spend the night in the room COVID-19 vaccine appointments The COVID-19 vaccine is available for children ages 6 months and up. Call [804-828-CHOR (2467)](tel:804-828-2467) to schedule an appointment. [Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine.](/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine) COVID testing for children and teens We no longer offer drive-thru COVID-19 testing. Testing is available for current patients by appointment only. Call [804-828-CHOR (2467)](mailto:tel:8048282467) to schedule an appointment or message
